intro.description:
This cheat sheet shows you how to create a new Proof Project to hold your proof scripts, then add some scripts.
Your new Proof Project will hold all your proof scripts for processing together. Files must be added to a project before they can be used in Proof General.

item.title: Launch the Proof Project Wizard
item.description:
On the File menu, select New > Project....
From the selection of available wizards, expand the Proof General folder, and select Proof Project.
Confirm your selection by pressing Next.

item.title: Name your project
item.description:
The next page of the wizard will appear. Name your project as you wish (though remember this must also be a valid direcrory name).
In general it is sensible to use default location, but be aware this might not be your preferred 'documents' store if you downloaded Proof General to a temporary location.
Press Finish to create your project. You will find your newly created project in the Project Explorer view, and can now add files to your project.

item.title: Create a new script
item.description:
This allows you to create a new script from a template. You can skip this step if you want to import a file.
From the File menu, select New > Proof Script.
Enter the Theory's name into the first box (The file name will be automatically generated). If container is blank, click Browse to select your new project; otherwise you can accept the default.
Press Finish to create your template file.

item.title: Import an existing script
item.description:
You must import existing theory files on disk in order to use them in scripting.
From the File menu, select Import...
From the wizard, select General > File System; press Next.
Type the directory containing your file into from, or find it using browse. Beneath here, directories appear on the left; files on the right. 'Tick' files you wish to import. Accept the default import location (or browse to find another project or project sub-folder).
Press Finish to import your selected files.

item.title: View your proof script
item.description: Your proof script should now appear in the Proof Explorer view, to the left of your screen by default. You can view any one of these scripts by double-clicking on its entry.
